data.title: Travis Barker's ex Shanna Moakler is 'praying' for rocker, Kourtney Kardashian & baby after he cancels tour
data.meta_description: TRAVIS Barker's ex-wife, Shanna Moakler, has offered the rock star and his new wife, Kourtney Kardashian, some kind words.Shanna graciously addressed
data.text:
TRAVIS Barker's ex-wife, Shanna Moakler, has offered the rock star and his new wife, Kourtney Kardashian, some kind words.

Shanna graciously addressed Travis' decision to cancel shows on the current Blink-182 tour because of a family emergency.

Paparazzi stopped the 48-year-old former beauty queen while she was running errands to conduct a short video interview.

The interviewer, who was off-camera, asked her if she heard about the "urgent family matter" that happened with "Blink-182 and Travis."

Shanna admitted that she heard the news, and that people were "reaching out" to her; however, she "didn't know what was going on."

The ex-reality star added that she "just knows that their kids [Alabama, Landon, and Travis' adoptive daughter Atiana De La Hoya] are safe and sound."

Shanna informed the questioner that though she didn't know the specifics of the situation, she did know that "whenever they [Blink-182] have to cancel shows, it's a really big deal."

The mother-of-three proceeded to send Travis, 47, and Kourtney, 44, an encouraging message.

"I'm just praying that his [Travis] immediate family, and the baby, and Kourtney, and everyone is safe and okay," Shanna expressed.

"I'll be sending my prayers and wishes," she closed with.

BABY BABY BABY

Fans suspect that the “urgent family matter” that had the band postpone gigs in the UK and Ireland because of Travis having to fly back to America was due to Kourtney being in labor.

Blink-182, who has been touring since March, was supposed to play in Glasgow, Belfast and Dublin over the next couple of days.

The music group's supporters are now hoping the issue is resolved before October, when they are expected to perform in London, Manchester and Birmingham.

The band took to their Stories on Friday morning to break the news: "Due to an urgent family matter, Travis has had to return home to the States.

"The Glasgow, Belfast, and Dublin shows are being postponed. More information in regards to his return to Europe and rescheduled dates will be provided as soon as available."

The hitmakers recently reunited for the first time in 10 years and recorded their new single Edging.

ALMOST HERE

Kourtney is currently pregnant with the couple's first child and has shown off her baby bump in recent weeks.

The news has sparked speculation that his absence is due to her and has expressed concern about the famous reality star.

In mid-June, Kourtney announced they were expecting their first child together at a Blink-182 concert in Los Angeles.

She held up a sign that said: "Travis, I'm pregnant" - a nod to the band's music video for All The Small Things.
